circle_intro_content_1: A Circle is a closed communication network that has independent server configurations, including a relay server, multiple file servers, and will soon include push servers and ICE servers for calls.
circle_intro_content_2: Each Circle has its own encrypted database. When you switch circles, you also switch databases, ensuring complete data isolation.
circle_intro_content_3: XChat only connects to your circle's relay. If there are any other connections, the app will notify you - there are no hidden connections.
circle_intro_feature_1_desc: Each circle is a self-contained network with its own relay, file servers, and infrastructure
circle_intro_feature_2_desc: Each circle has its own encrypted database, completely isolated from others
circle_intro_feature_3_desc: XChat only connects to your circle's relay - no hidden connections
circle_intro_feature_4_desc: Switch between circles seamlessly, each with its own data and contacts
circle_intro_how_step_3: 3. The app will connect to the relay and create your Circle
circle_intro_relay_answer: A Nostr relay is a server that stores and forwards messages in the Nostr network. Think of it as a post office for decentralized communication. Relays receive messages from users, store them temporarily, and forward them to other users who are interested in receiving them. In XChat, each Circle connects to one specific relay, creating a closed communication network where all messages are routed through that relay server.
circle_intro_faq_question_1: Can a circle only bind to one relay?
circle_intro_faq_answer_1:
Yes, the purpose of XChat binding one circle to one relay is:
1. Improve message reliability
2. Improve privacy
circle_intro_faq_answer_2: Yes, you can delete a circle in Settings -> Circle Settings -> top right corner (...). Note: Deleting a circle will delete the local database, and the data cannot be recovered.
circle_intro_note: Note: Each Circle is completely independent. Your contacts and messages in one Circle won't appear in another, and each has its own encrypted database.
